name: WattsHome
0:
”Alexa, set thermostat to Heat mode.”
”Alexa, turn up the Bathroom.”
”Alexa, set the Kitchen to 85.”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Using the Watts Home skill and Alexa, you can control your Watts Home devices with your voice and routines. To begin, select the ‘Enable Skill’ button in the Alexa App to link your Watts Home account and connect your supported device(s).

Watts Home devices that are currently supported by the Watts Home Skill include:
• ConnectPlus® Thermostat
• Invita® WiFi Thermostat 564

To use the skill, you need to specify which device to use by name. You can define these names by doing either of the following methods:
1. Use the device name(s) you currently set up – these are the names of your devices currently displayed in the Watts Home app. You can change the name of a device at any time from within the Watts Home app.
2. Create an Alexa group, like Kitchen or Upstairs, and add the device to the group.
Using the name of your device/group, you can say any of the following: “Alexa, make the Kitchen cooler”, or “Alexa, set Upstairs temperature to 75”.
